content.text: Measure the marked angle
Work out \(\sqrt{5} \times 6^{2}\)
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
A journey starts at 21 15 one day and ends at 04 33 the next day
Calculate the time taken, in hours and minutes
Calculate the **total** surface area of this cuboid
Write down the gradient of the line \(y = 5x + 7.\)
Find the coordinates of the point where the line \(y = 5x + 7\) crosses the \(y\)-axis
**Using a ruler and compasses only,** construct this triangle
Leave in your construction arcs
The side of length \(12\mathrm{cm}\) has been drawn for you
Write down the inequality, in terms of \(n\), shown by the number line
triangle \(A\) after a reflection in the \(y\)-axis,
triangle \(A\) after a translation by the vector \(\left(\begin{array}{c}{-3}\\{-4}\end{array}\right)\)
On the grid, draw the image of
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
Factorise completely
The \(n\) th term of a sequence is \(n^{2} + 7\)
Find the first three terms of this sequence
These are the first four terms of a different sequence
Find the \(n\) th term of this sequence
As the temperature increases, people eat more ice cream
What type of correlation does this statement describe?
Sanjay invests \(\)700\(in an account paying simple interest at a rate of 2.5\% per year
Calculate the value of his investment at the end of 6 years
Meera invests \(\)700\(in an account paying compound interest at a rate of \(r\%\) per year
At the end of 17 years the value of her investment is \(\)1030.35\$
Find the value of \(r\)
Simplify \(h^{2} \times h^{5}\)
Simplify \(\left(\frac{7}{x}\right)^{-3}\)
Find the value of \(p\)
Calculate the circumference of a circle with radius \(4.7 \mathrm{cm}\)
Without using a calculator, work out \(2\frac{1}{3}\times \frac{11}{14}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
Find the equation of the straight line, \(l\), that passes through point \(A\) and point \(B\)
Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\)
Find the equation of the line that is perpendicular to \(l\) and passes through the origin
\(A\) is the point \((- 6, 5)\) and \(B\) is the point \((- 2, - 3)\)
The diagram shows a rectangle \(OPQR\) with length 11 cm and width 4 cm
\(OQ\) is a diagonal and \(OPX\) is a sector of a circle, centre \(O\)
Calculate the percentage of the rectangle that is shaded
Mrs Kohli buys a jacket, 2 shirts and a hat
The jacket costs \(\$ x\)
The shirts each cost \(\$ 24\) less than the jacket and the hat costs \(\$ 16\) less than the jacket
Mrs Kohli spends exactly \(\$ 100\)
Write down an equation in terms of \(x\)
Solve this equation to find the cost of the jacket
\(y\) is inversely proportional to the square root of \((x + 4)\)
When \(x = 5, y = 2\)
Find \(y\) when \(x = 77\)
Solve the simultaneous equations

Calculate the angle between the stick and the base of the box
\(AM = 30 \text{cm}\)
Show that \(GM = 4.8 \text{cm}\), correct to 1 decimal place

\(AB = 18.6 \text{cm}, BC = 9 \text{cm}\) and \(CG = 14.5 \text{cm}\)
A straight stick \(AGM\) rests against \(A\) and \(G\) and extends outside the box to \(M\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{PQ}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\) in its simplest form
\(\overrightarrow{PQ} =\)   .........
When \(PQ\) and \(OR\) are extended, they intersect at \(W\)
Find the position vector of \(W\)
The diagram shows a trapezium \(OPQR\)
\(O\) is the origin, \(\overrightarrow{OR} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OP} = \mathbf{b}\)
